{"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. Exceptions & Questions: Consult the [Graduate Studies\nCommittee](mailto:gradstudies_comm@rose-\nhulman.edu?subject=Graduate%20Studies%20Inquiry).\n\n## **Eligibility to Participate in Commencement**\n\n### Project or Thesis Graduate Degree-Seeking Students\n\nTo be eligible to participate in Commencement, project or thesis, graduate\ndegree-seeking students must have completed their final oral examination by\nthe Friday of the sixth week of the Spring Quarter and completed all the\nrequirements for the graduate degree by the Friday of the eighth week of the\nSpring Quarter.\n\nStudents completing their degree requirements in the Summer or Fall Quarters\nare eligible to participate in the Spring Commencement as \"Anticipated Summer\nCompletion\" or \"Anticipated Fall Completion.\" In consultation with the\nstudent's Committee Chair, the Associate Dean of Lifelong Learning will inform\nthe Registrar's Office if a student will participate in Commencement and the\nappropriate anticipated quarter of completion.\n\nProject or thesis graduate degree-seeking students participating in\nCommencement will be individually hooded on the platform as they are\nrecognized for their degree. In addition, graduates for the entire academic\nyear will be listed by name in the Commencement Program, along with their\nproject or thesis title.\n\n### Course-based Graduate Degree-Seeking Students\n\nA course-based graduate degree-seeking student may participate in Commencement\nif they have completed all graduation requirements for their program of study\nby the end of the Spring quarter.\n\nAdditionally, course-based graduate degree-seeking students can participate in\nCommencement as a Summer or Fall Completion. The following sections outline\nthe criteria.\n\n### Summer Completion\n\nA course-based graduate student who, at the end of the Spring quarter, has two\nor fewer courses [eight credit hours or less] to complete graduation\nrequirements and who, by the judgment of the Associate Dean of Lifelong\nLearning, has a reasonable expectation of completing those courses in the\nSummer quarter, may participate in Commencement and be designated in the\nCommencement Program as an \"Anticipated Summer Completion.\"\n\n### Fall Completion\n\nA course-based graduate student who, at the end of the Spring quarter, has\nfive or fewer courses to complete graduation requirements [twenty credit hours\nor less] and who, by the judgment of the Associate Dean of Lifelong Learning,\nhas a reasonable expectation of completing those courses by the end of the\nFall quarter, may participate in Commencement and be designated in the\nCommencement Program as an \"Anticipated Fall Completion.\"\n\nIn consultation with the relevant Department Head, the Associate Dean of\nLifelong Learning will inform the Registrar's Office of students with\nanticipated Summer and Fall Completions who will participate in Commencement.\n\nNote: Summer and Fall Quarter completions (graduates) will be considered\nmembers of the class graduating in the Spring of that calendar year.\n\n### Graduate Degree Regalia\n\nStudents who plan to participate in Commencement should contact the Rose-\nHulman Bookstore to purchase their regalia no later than Friday of the eighth\nweek of the Spring Quarter.\n\nDiploma/Letter of Completion Upon completing all graduate degree requirements,\nthe Registrar will provide a letter of completion and official transcripts.\n\n", "lemma": "Exceptions Questions: Consult [Graduate Studies Committee](mailto:gradstudies_comm@rose- hulman.edu?subject=Graduate%20Studies%20Inquiry). ## **Eligibility Participate Commencement** ### Project Thesis Graduate Degree-Seeking Students be eligible participate Commencement, project thesis, graduate degree-seeking student have complete final oral examination Friday sixth week Spring Quarter complete requirement graduate degree Friday eighth week Spring Quarter. Students complete degree requirement Summer Fall Quarters be eligible participate Spring Commencement \"Anticipated Summer Completion\" \"Anticipated Fall Completion.\" consultation student's Committee Chair, Associate Dean Lifelong Learning inform Registrar's Office student participate Commencement appropriate anticipated quarter completion. Project thesis graduate degree-seeking student participate Commencement be individually hood platform be recognize degree. addition, graduate entire academic year be list name Commencement Program, project thesis title. ### Course-based Graduate Degree-Seeking Students course-based graduate degree-seeking student participate Commencement have complete graduation requirement program study end Spring quarter. Additionally, course-based graduate degree-seeking student participate Commencement Summer Fall Completion. following section outline criteria. ### Summer Completion A course-based graduate student who, end Spring quarter, have few course [eight credit hour less] complete graduation requirement who, judgment Associate Dean Lifelong Learning, have reasonable expectation complete course Summer quarter, participate Commencement be designate Commencement Program \"Anticipated Summer Completion.\" ### Fall Completion A course-based graduate student who, end Spring quarter, have few course complete graduation requirement [twenty credit hour less] who, judgment Associate Dean Lifelong Learning, have reasonable expectation complete course end Fall quarter, participate Commencement be designate Commencement Program \"Anticipated Fall Completion.\" consultation relevant Department Head, Associate Dean Lifelong Learning inform Registrar's Office student anticipated Summer Fall Completions participate Commencement. Note: Summer Fall Quarter completion (graduates) be consider member class graduating Spring calendar year. ### Graduate Degree Regalia Students plan participate Commencement contact Rose- Hulman Bookstore purchase regalia no later Friday eighth week Spring Quarter. If the petition is submitted after this\ndeadline, the student will not be able to graduate until the end of the\nfollowing term at the earliest. (In the case of a student scheduled for\ngraduation in spring term, this would mean graduation in August at the\nearliest.) No petition for exception may be brought to the entire Faculty\nuntil the Curriculum Committee has made its recommendation.  \n  \n**Deadline**  \n  \nAny senior who has a required course for graduation for which no final grade\nhas been submitted to the Registrar by 9 a.m. Monday following the last day of\nclasses will be classified as [Summer Completion](summer-completion.html).  \n  \n **GPA requirement**  \n  \nThe student must have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.000. The medal\nwill be given to that scholar who also has the highest number of graded hours\nat Rose-Hulman.  \n  \n**Special awards**  \n  \nThe John T. The student must be dedicated to serving the Rose-\nHulman community and the service must be distinguished as a commendable\ninfluence on the members of that community. If, in the opinion of the Faculty\nand Professional Staff, there is no qualified candidate, the Moench\nCommendation will not be awarded.  \n  \n**Degrees with distinction**  \n  \nA student who has completed all the requirements for the Bachelor of Science\ndegree with a cumulative GPA of 3.900 or more shall be awarded the degree\nsumma cum laude. A graduating student with a cumulative GPA of 3.600 or more\nshall be awarded the degree magna cum laude. A graduating student with a\ncumulative GPA of 3.300 or more shall be awarded the degree cum laude.  \n  \n**Exceptions & Questions:** Consult the [Honors and Awards\nCommittee](mailto:claassen@rose-hulman.edu).\n\n", "lemma": "medal be give scholar also have high number graded hour Rose-Hulman. **Special awards** John T. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology desires to create\na procedure separate from the student Discipline and Suspension policy for\nthose students engaged in certain inappropriate behaviors (as described below)\nresulting from medical reasons. Subject to Rose-Hulman Institute of\nTechnology's duties under the \"Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990\" and\n\"Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973\", a student may be\nadministratively withdrawn involuntarily from the Institute.  \n  \n**Process**  \n  \nThe Involuntary Medical Withdrawal process will be initiated and a student may\nbe administratively withdrawn from Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology when,\nin the judgment of the Vice-President for Student Affairs, the student's\nmedical condition involves one or more of the following:\n\n  1. A significant danger or imminent threat of harm to self, others, or property.\n  ", "lemma": "Rose-Hulman Institute Technology desire create procedure separate student Discipline Suspension policy student engage certain inappropriate behavior (as describe below) result medical reasons. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. 4. The Vice-President for Student Affairs may invoke a summary suspension that will result in the student's immediate withdrawal from the Institute. (This may be necessary for the well-being of the student, other persons, or of the Institute.) The student must comply with this decision, but may proceed with the appeal process within the 48 hour appeal period.\n\n**Appeal process**  \n  \nThe student may appeal the Vice President of Student Affairs' decision to the\ncommittee consisting of the Rules and Discipline Committee and the Director of\nInternational Student Services and Special Programs. Any appeal must be\nsubmitted to the chair of the Rules and Discipline Committee in writing within\n48 hours of the Vice-President's determination.  \n  \nAn appeal meeting will be scheduled to allow the student to present relevant\ninformation concerning the matter. A representative (a student, faculty, or\nstaff member from Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology) may be present to\nassist the student throughout the formal process.  \n  \nAt the conclusion of the meeting with the Committee, all information will be\nconsidered and a letter will be furnished to the student and the Vice-\nPresident for Student Affairs containing the committee's conclusions regarding\nthe appeal.  \n  \n**Re-Admittance**  \n  \nIf an involuntary medical withdrawal occurs, conditions for re-admittance may\nbe imposed by the Vice President of Student Affairs at the time of the\nwithdrawal. As the result of an involuntary medical withdrawal under this\npolicy, a student may be asked to submit, prior to resuming classes or on-\ncampus residence, a letter to the Vice-President for Student Affairs from a\nlicensed health care professional stating that the student is capable of\nresuming academic course work and adhering to the responsibilities of living\nin a residence hall community. In addition, the student will schedule and\nattend a meeting with the Admissions and Standing Committee as a condition of\nreadmission. ", "lemma": "Vice-President Student Affairs invoke summary suspension result student's immediate withdrawal Institute. (This be necessary well-being student, other persons, Institute.) student comply decision, proceed appeal process hour appeal period. **Appeal process** student appeal Vice President Student Affairs' decision committee consist Rules Discipline Committee Director International Student Services Special Programs. Any appeal be submit chair Rules Discipline Committee write hour Vice-President's determination. appeal meeting be schedule allow student present relevant information concern matter. A representative (a student, faculty, staff member Rose-Hulman Institute Technology) be present assist student formal process. conclusion meeting Committee, information be consider letter be furnish student Vice- President Student Affairs contain committee's conclusion regard appeal. **Re-Admittance** involuntary medical withdrawal occurs, condition re-admittance be impose Vice President Student Affairs time withdrawal. result involuntary medical withdrawal policy, student be ask submit, prior resume class on- campus residence, letter Vice-President Student Affairs licensed health care professional stating student be capable resume academic course work adhere responsibility living residence hall community. addition, student schedule attend meeting Admissions Standing Committee condition readmission."}

This meeting can be arranged through the assistance of the Vice-\nPresident for Student Affairs or the Registrar's Office. ", "lemma": "meeting be arrange assistance Vice- President Student Affairs Registrar's Office."}

They should have, as of the end of the spring\nterm, 24 hours or less of course requirements to complete and be able to\ndemonstrate that they can reasonably fulfill all requirements by November. (If\nthey have 12 hours or less to complete, they qualify for SUMMER COMPLETION.)\n\nNOTE: November graduates, regardless of which Commencement ceremony they\nchoose to participate in, are normally considered members of the class that\ngraduates in the spring of that calendar year.\n\n**Exceptions & Questions:** Consult the [Dean of\nFaculty](mailto:deanoffaculty@rose-hulman.edu).\n\n", "lemma": "[White Background Triangle Pattern](../../../../assets/images/overlay- images/img-white-triangle.jpg) Rules Procedures November Completion Learn more Academic Rules Procedures Rose\u2011Hulman. * [Home](../../../../index.html) * [Campus Life](../../../index.html) * [Student Services](../../index.html) * [Office Registrar](../index.html) * [Rules Procedures](index.html) * [November Completion](november-completion.html) **In section** Open Close ### Overview * [Student Records](../student-records/index.html) * [Registration Services](../registration-services/index.html) * [Forms](../forms.html) * [Calendars Schedules](../academic-calendars.html) * [Rules Procedures](index.html) * [Course Catalog](../../../../academics/course-catalog/2019-2020/index.html) * [Contact Registrar](../contact-us.html) ## November Completion Seniors expect complete graduation requirement end fall term petition Registrar attend precede Spring Commencement be recognize \"November Completions.\" (That is, be quarter work, wish participate ceremony classmates' graduate.) have, end spring term, hour less course requirement complete be able demonstrate reasonably fulfill requirement November. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. **Overload policy**\n\nWith the approval of the [Advisor](advisors.html), a student who is not on\nacademic [Probation](probation-and-dismissal.html), may schedule credits in\naddition to the maximum normal load according to the following table:\n\n**Cumulative GPA** | **Maximum Overload**  \n---|---  \nLess than 2.600 | no overload  \nAt least 2.600 | 4 credits  \nAt least 3.300 | 6 credits  \n  \n**Procedure**\n\nA student whose GPA meets the stipulated limit for the Overload may simply\nregister as usual.\n\nA student whose GPA does not meet the stipulated limit must request an\nOverload by submitting a letter to the Registrar explaining why the exception\nis needed, how the additional work load will be handled, and indicate which\ncourse(s) are considered to be the Overload. ", "lemma": "**Overload policy** approval [Advisor](advisors.html), student be not academic [Probation](probation-and-dismissal.html), schedule credit addition maximum normal load accord following table: **Cumulative GPA** | **Maximum Overload** ---|--- Less | overload least | credit least | credit **Procedure** student GPA meet stipulated limit Overload simply register usual. A student GPA do not meet stipulated limit request Overload submit letter Registrar explain exception be needed, additional work load be handled, indicate course(s) be consider be Overload."}
{"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. The Admissions and Standing\nCommittee will meet to consider these requested Overloads, usually after the\nfinal grades for the current term are in. The Committee will typically notify\nstudents of its decision during the second week of classes. The fact that a\nstudent is pursuing a double major or two degrees is NOT a sufficient reason\nfor approving an Overload for a student who does not meet the GPA requirement.\nIf the petition is denied, the student will be informed and the Overload\ncourse(s) will be dropped.\n\n**Fees**\n\nStudents pay an additional fee for each credit over 18 in a term, exclusive of\nRHIT100 Foundations for Rose-Hulman Success. Consult the Registrar's Office.\n\n", "lemma": "Admissions Standing Committee meet consider request Overloads, usually final grade current term be in. For more information, see [Classification of\nStudents](classification-of-students.html).\n\n**Guidelines  \n** A student may register as a Part-Time Student or reduce their course load\nto become a Part-Time Student at their discretion. Being a Part-Time Student\nmay have implications for:  \n\u2022 Financial aid and student loan repayment  \n\u2022 Insurance  \n\u2022 Visa status for international students  \n\u2022 Eligibility for athletics  \n\u2022 Scheduling of required courses with prerequisites  \n\u2022 Other individual-specific concerns\n\nStudents intending to be a Part-Time Student should discuss these implications\nwith their advisor and a representative from the Financial Aid Office, if\nappropriate. International students must discuss their intention to be a Part-\nTime Student with the Director of International Student Services.\n\n**Limitations  \n** Academic probation can only be removed for satisfactory work as a Full-Time\nStudent at Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology.\n\nIf a student wishes to be a Part-Time Student for more than two quarters\n(consecutive or non-consecutive), permission must be requested from the\nAdmissions and Standing Committee. Before granting permission for a third term\nof Part-Time study, the Committee will evaluate whether the student is making\nsatisfactory academic progress.\n\n**Exceptions & Questions:** Consult the [Admissions and Standing\nCommittee](mailto:admstand_comm@rose-hulman.edu).\n\n", "lemma": "more information, see [Classification Students](classification-of-students.html). **Guidelines ** student register Part-Time Student reduce course load become Part-Time Student discretion. A [Transfer\nStudent](transfer-students.html) assumes the GPA requirements of the class the\nstudent enters.\n\n", "lemma": "Javascript be enable correct page display Skip content ![White Background Triangle Pattern](../../../../assets/images/overlay- images/img-white-triangle.jpg) Rules Procedures Probation Dismissal Learn more Academic Rules Procedures Rose\u2011Hulman. * [Home](../../../../index.html) * [Campus Life](../../../index.html) * [Student Services](../../index.html) * [Office Registrar](../index.html) * [Rules Procedures](index.html) * [Probation Dismissal](probation-and-dismissal.html) **In section** Open Close ### Overview * [Student Records](../student-records/index.html) * [Registration Services](../registration-services/index.html) * [Forms](../forms.html) * [Calendars Schedules](../academic-calendars.html) * [Rules Procedures](index.html) * [Course Catalog](../../../../academics/course-catalog/2019-2020/index.html) * [Contact Registrar](../contact-us.html) ## Probation Dismissal end term, student term [Grade Point Average](gpa.html) (GPA) cumulative GPA fall level show follow table be place Academic Probation succeed term. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. **Terms** | **Minimum Term GPA** | **Minimum Cumulative GPA**  \n---|---|---  \n1-3 | 1.800 | 1.800  \n4-12 | 2.000 | 2.000  \n  \n  \nIf a student's term GPA falls below the required level, the student acquires\none probation. If a student's cumulative GPA falls below the required level,\nthe student acquires one probation. It is thus possible for a student to\nacquire a maximum of two probations in one quarter.  \nAny student placed on probation in a given term can be required to appear\nbefore the Admissions and Standing Committee as a condition of remaining in\nthe Institute.  \n**Removal of academic probation**  \nAt the end of any term in which a student was enrolled in 12 hours or more,\nand whose term GPA and Cumulative GPA meet the minimum level as shown in the\ntable above, the student will be removed from academic probation. All courses\nmust be taken for graded credit, and may not include courses on the Audit or\n[Pass/Fail](pass-fail.html) basis.  \n", "lemma": "**Terms** | **Minimum Term GPA** | **Minimum Cumulative GPA** ---|---|--- 1-3 | | 4-12 | student's term GPA fall required level, student acquire probation. student's cumulative GPA fall required level, student acquire probation. be thus possible student acquire maximum probation quarter. Any student place probation give term be require appear Admissions Standing Committee condition remain Institute. **Removal academic probation** end term student be enrol hour more, term GPA Cumulative GPA meet minimum level show table above, student be remove academic probation. course be take graded credit, not include course Audit [Pass/Fail](pass-fail.html) basis."}

{"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. The Admissions and\nStanding Committee will determine whether the student shall be readmitted.  \nAny student who has been suspended for disciplinary reasons and wishes to be\nreadmitted at the end of the suspension period must submit a written petition\nto the Dean of Students who will review it. After the review, the Dean of\nStudents will submit a recommendation to the Admissions and Standing\nCommittee. In addition, the student will schedule and attend a meeting with\nthe Admissions and Standing Committee as a condition of readmission. The\nstudent must contact the Registrar regarding meeting times and dates. The\nAdmissions and Standing Committee will determine whether the student shall be\nreadmitted. StipulationThe student may not appear before the Admissions and\nStanding Committee until all outstanding financial obligations to the\nInstitute are settled.\n\n**Degree requirements**\n\nStudents readmitted after an absence of one year or more must complete all\nrequirements in effect at the time of readmission. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. Exceptions are permitted for uncompleted required courses, which should\ntake precedence. Other exceptions are strongly discouraged due to ultimate\nscheduling difficulties that will arise in future terms, since the \"Schedule\nof Classes\" for each term is made up in accordance with the published\ncurricula.  \nDepartures from the established curricula are permitted for those\n[classified](classification-of-students.html) as Special Students.  \n  \n**Prerequisites**  \n  \nNo course may be scheduled by a student unless the established prerequisites\nfor that course have been satisfied. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. Javascript must be enabled for the correct page display\n\nSkip to content\n\n![White Background with Triangle Pattern](../../../../assets/images/overlay-\nimages/img-white-triangle.jpg)\n\n# Rules & Procedures - Repeating a Course\n\nLearn more about the Academic Rules & Procedures at Rose\u2011Hulman.\n\n  * [Home](../../../../index.html)\n  * [Campus Life](../../../index.html)\n  * [Student Services](../../index.html)\n  * [Office of the Registrar](../index.html)\n  * [Rules & Procedures](index.html)\n  * [Repeating a Course](repeating-a-course.html)\n\n**In this section** Open Close\n\n### Overview\n\n  * [Student Records](../student-records/index.html)\n  * [Registration Services](../registration-services/index.html)\n  * [Forms](../forms.html)\n  * [Calendars & Schedules](../academic-calendars.html)\n  * [Rules & Procedures](index.html)\n  * [Course Catalog](../../../../academics/course-catalog/2019-2020/index.html)\n  * [Contact the Registrar](../contact-us.html)\n\n## Repeating a Course\n\n**Overlapping material**  \nIn some instances, with the approval of the advisor, a student may elect to\ntake a course which essentially repeats material in a course already taken and\nfor which credit has been received. In such cases, no additional credits or\ngrade points will be recorded unless the second course carries more hours of\ncredit. In that case, credit and grade point will be recorded to the extent by\nwhich the total number of credits for the second course exceeds those recorded\nfor the original course. The exception to this is [Grade Replacement](grade-\nreplacement.html).  \n **Failed courses**  \nA student who has received an \"F\" in a course must repeat the entire course in\norder to obtain credit, either by enrolling for it again at Rose-Hulman or by\n[Transfer Credit](transfer-credits.html). It is particularly important to note\nthat:\n\n  1. ", "lemma": "case, credit grade point be record extent total number credit second course exceeds record original course. exception be [Grade Replacement](grade- replacement.html). **Failed courses** A student have receive \"F\" course repeat entire course order obtain credit, enrol again Rose-Hulman [Transfer Credit](transfer-credits.html). be particularly important note that:"}
{"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. [Credit By Examination](credit-by-examination.html) may not be used to obtain credit for failed courses;\n  2. The \"F\" will remain on the student's permanent record and cannot be removed by subsequent satisfactory work. (This is true even in the case of [Grade Replacement](grade-replacement.html) where the \"F\", although no longer averaged into the student's GPA, still remains on the academic record.)\n\n**Exceptions & Questions:** Consult the [Admissions and Standing\nCommittee](mailto:admstand_comm@rose-hulman.edu).\n\n", "lemma": "[Credit Examination](credit-by-examination.html) not be use obtain credit fail courses; \"F\" remain student's permanent record cannot be remove subsequent satisfactory work. No more than eight credit hours in named, required courses of the student's major may be transferred after the last term in residence. These credits must have prior approval of the Head of the student's major department. The Department Head shall have the responsibility of determining the acceptability of courses taken at other institutions.\n  3. Some courses\nare not eligible for completion via transfer credit and must be taken at Rose-\nHulman. The applicant's record and transcripts will be examined by the\nAdmissions Office, which will give the student a preliminary evaluation of\nwhich courses are likely to transfer.  \n**Evaluation of credits**  \nNormally, a meeting for Transfer Students is held prior to the beginning of\nthe term to evaluate [Transfer Credits](transfer-credits.html). Each course\nfor which the student seeks Transfer Credit will be evaluated in writing by\nthe Head of the Department (or designated representative) in which that course\nwould be offered or, if the course is one not normally offered at Rose-Hulman,\nby the department most nearly related. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. **Overload fee**  \nStudents pay an additional fee for each credit hour over eighteen taken in a\nterm, exclusive of College and Life Skills. See [Overload\n](overloads.html)procedures.  \n**Refunds**  \nRules regarding refunds of tuition and fees are available in the [Student\nHandbook. ](../../../student-life/_assets/Student-Handbook.pdf)  \n**Suspension**  \nA student suspended for disciplinary reasons forfeits all rights to a refund\nof any portion of the fees paid and will remain liable for all monies owed.  \n**Exceptions & Questions:** Consult the [Dean of\nStudents](mailto:deanofstudentsoffice@rose-hulman.edu).\n\n", "lemma": "**Overload fee** Students pay additional fee credit hour eighteen take term, exclusive College Life Skills. {"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. The plan of study must include all requirements of both departments and must\ncontain at least 32 quarter hours of work more than the requirements of either\ndepartment curriculum alone. The additional credits may be earned during\nsummers (including [Transfer Credit](transfer-credits.html)), by Overloads\nduring the academic year, or by additional terms of enrollment at Rose-Hulman.  \n**Procedure**  \nSame as that for [Double Major](double-major.html).  \n", "lemma": "plan study include requirement department contain least quarter hour work more requirement department curriculum additional credit be earn summer (including [Transfer Credit](transfer-credits.html)), Overloads academic year, additional term enrollment Rose-Hulman. **Procedure** Same [Double Major](double-major.html)."}
{"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. **Limitation**  \nSome two-degree program combinations are prohibited. In particular, two-degree\nprograms are prohibited if they do not automatically require 32 hours in\naddition to the requirements of either degree alone after all common courses\n(including routine substitutions) are utilized. For example, two-degree\nprograms in Mathematics & Computer Science, Mathematics & Economics, Optical\nEngineering & Physics, and Computer Engineering & Electrical Engineering are\nprohibited. Upon petition, the Curriculum Committee may grant exceptions to\nthese prohibitions for exceptionally well thought-out programs which meet the\n32-hour rule by including elective upper-level courses from the majors in\nquestion.  \nIMPORTANT NOTE: The fact that a student is pursuing a Two Degree Program is\nNOT a sufficient reason for approving [an overload](overloads.html) when the\nstudent's GPA is low.  \n**Exceptions & Questions:** Consult the [Curriculum\nCommittee](mailto:curr_comm@rose-hulman.edu).\n\n", "lemma": "**Limitation** two-degree program combination be prohibited. particular, two-degree program be prohibit do not automatically require hour addition requirement degree alone common course (including routine substitutions) be utilized. example, two-degree program Mathematics Computer Science, Mathematics Economics, Optical Engineering Physics, Computer Engineering Electrical Engineering be prohibited. Curriculum Committee grant exception prohibition exceptionally well thought-out program meet 32-hour rule include elective upper-level course major question. IMPORTANT NOTE: fact student be pursue Degree Program be NOT sufficient reason approve [an overload](overloads.html) student's GPA be low. **Exceptions Questions:** Consult [Curriculum Committee](mailto:curr_comm@rose-hulman.edu)."}

This Form contains a clearance from the\nDean of Students, the Dean of the Faculty, the Advisor, and various\ndepartments of Rose-Hulman which may have financial charges against the\nstudent. ", "lemma": "Javascript be enable correct page display Skip content ![White Background Triangle Pattern](../../../../assets/images/overlay- images/img-white-triangle.jpg) Rules Procedures Withdrawal Learn more Academic Rules Procedures Rose\u2011Hulman. * [Home](../../../../index.html) * [Campus Life](../../../index.html) * [Student Services](../../index.html) * [Office Registrar](../index.html) * [Rules Procedures](index.html) * [Withdrawal](withdrawal.html) **In section** Open Close ### Overview * [Student Records](../student-records/index.html) * [Registration Services](../registration-services/index.html) * [Forms](../forms.html) * [Calendars Schedules](../academic-calendars.html) * [Rules Procedures](index.html) * [Course Catalog](../../../../academics/course-catalog/2019-2020/index.html) * [Contact Registrar](../contact-us.html) ## Withdrawal Withdrawal Course: Review [Drop/Add](drop-and-add.html) procedure. Form contain clearance Dean Students, Dean Faculty, Advisor, various department Rose-Hulman have financial charge student."}
{"source": "registrar", "text": "This is about registrar. This is about registrar. This is about registrar. No financial settlement can be made until this Form is completed.  \nIn the event a student withdraws, any unpaid charges will be noted in the\nacademic file and no requests [for transcripts](transcripts.html) or\n[readmission ](readmission.html)will be acted upon until such charges are\npaid.  \n**Grades**  \nFor a student withdrawing from Rose-Hulman, the usual Drop/Add provisions\napply with respect to grades. That is, if withdrawal occurs before the end of\nthe 8th week, all grades will be recorded as \"W\"; if a student wishes to\nwithdraw after 8th week the student must receive a waiver from the Admissions\nand Standing Committee because of special exigency.  \n**For more information:**\n\n  * [Refunds](../../../../admissions-and-aid/financial-aid/financial-aid-basics/understanding-financial-aid/refund-policy-and-return-of-title-iv-aid.html)\n  * [Readmission](readmission.html)\n  * [Involuntary Medical Withdrawal](medical-withdrawal.html)\n\n**Exceptions & Questions:** Consult the [Dean of\nStudents](mailto:deanofstudentsoffice@rose-hulman.edu).\n\n", "lemma": "financial settlement be make Form be completed. event student withdraws, unpaid charge be note academic file request [for transcripts](transcripts.html) [readmission ](readmission.html)will be act such charge be paid. **Grades** student withdraw Rose-Hulman, usual Drop/Add provision apply respect grades. is, withdrawal occur end week, grade be record \"W\"; student wish withdraw week student receive waiver Admissions Standing Committee special exigency. **For more information:** * [Refunds](../../../../admissions-and-aid/financial-aid/financial-aid-basics/understanding-financial-aid/refund-policy-and-return-of-title-iv-aid.html) * [Readmission](readmission.html) * [Involuntary Medical Withdrawal](medical-withdrawal.html) **Exceptions Questions:** Consult [Dean Students](mailto:deanofstudentsoffice@rose-hulman.edu)."}
